payload.name: likelihood-based
payload.core: Compare how well hypotheses predict observed data via likelihoods, without committing to priors; focuses on what data say about hypotheses rather than full posterior beliefs.
proc: compute likelihood of data under each hypothesis
calculate likelihood ratios for pairwise comparison

diff.vs_bayesian: separates data support from belief after priors; sits between Bayesian and frequentist idioms
diff.vs_abductive: quantitative likelihood comparison vs qualitative hypothesis selection

fail.desc: ignoring base rates/priors when they matter for decisions; likelihood ratios alone don't tell you which hypothesis is more probable

ex.scenario: comparing two diagnostic hypotheses given patient symptoms
ex.approach: compute P(symptoms|disease_A) vs P(symptoms|disease_B), report likelihood ratio as evidence strength
